column4: im trying to run the live cd, but my computer is refusing to boot from any live cd, and ive set it in the bios to boot from cd first. any suggestions?
if you really want to see if it'll boot from the CD, disconnect your hard drive and floppy manually, and only leave the CDROM attached
then it just says operating system not found
do you have another bootable CD of anything else ?
i will try a different live cd but i think it still doesnt work
if your computer is unable to boot from two different live cds, don't you think it might not be an ubuntu problem?
have you tried booting with a windows cd?
i dunno whats wrong, cause the light on the cd rom drive flash, and you can hear it spinning up but for some reason it does not boot from it... this is also the second cd rom that ive tried
most likely a comp problem... great.
great thing about open source, programs can be ported =)
you could be a big nerd and install cygwin and run irssi
but this is windows your talking about, it has enough trouble running its own programs, let alone programs in cgywin or gtk ;)
i run GAIM in windows, and GAIM does irc.
i like xchat better, although i do use gaim in windows
there is, but the offical xchat version (made by the xchat devs) costs money, while someone just made another port and its free.
